Delgadillo-Calzadilla},   journal = {Journal of Marine Science and Engineering},   year = {2022},   volume = {10},   number = {1},   pages = {26},   url = {https://doi.org/10.3390/jmse10010026}, }

title: Coastal Changes Estimation Based on Baseline and Transect Approach
text: CoastCR open source package computing coastline time series trend analysis using baseline transect approach. tool part ODSAS (Open Digital Shoreline Analysis System v1.0) uses CoastCR SAGA GIS [1, 2]. CoastCR main input points representing intersections along transects perpendicular baseline, set date-stamped coastlines (obtained mapping stage using SAGA GIS) calculates standard metrics coastline change rate change similarly metrics produced using Digital Shoreline Analysis System (DSAS) [3, 4]. Package website: https://alejandro-gomez.github.io/CoastCR/

title: Coastal Changes Estimation Based on Baseline and Transect Approach
text: CoastCR 1.2.0. version incorporates change Date format. Currently, user can select one shoreline day. , user introduced table dates associated uncertainty column named “Day” format (YYYYY-mm-dd). information acquisition hour available, user introduce column called “Hour” format (HH:MM:SS). Now column names “Day”, “Hour” “Uncertainty”. data include hour information, remove column avoid possible errors. Contents: package used ? Installation Example Package citation Authors Contact References Citations

what: What is this package used for?
title: Coastal Changes Estimation Based on Baseline and Transect Approach
text: Many researchers practitioners interested Shoreline Change Analysis often separate mapping stages (mostly done within GIS) time series trend analyses, can undertaken programming environment [1]. package intended used time series trend analyses using R programming environment open-source software. main functions implemented , CoastCR used : Compute coastline change using common change metrics used transects baseline method. Two main functions included current version filter estimate parameters: Baseline filter: function part pre-processing stages used ensure baseline-transect, one crossing date-stamped coastline used. given transect date-stamped coastline, one crossing found (e.g., might happen wiggly coastlines), filter selects crossing closest baseline neglects others. Coast rates: function estimates main five key measures individual transect also produce aggregates transects identically within DSAS tool [2]. five metrics : NSM: Net Shoreline Movement (m). EPR: End Point Rate (m yr-1). SCE: Shoreline Change Envelope (m). LRR: Linear Regression Rate (m yr-1). WLR: Weighted Linear Regression Rate (m yr-1).   Coastline Variations main function runs aforementioned functions. First, filters intersection points calculates key measures change.

title: Coastal Changes Estimation Based on Baseline and Transect Approach
code: # To install the latest version from Github: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("alejandro-gomez/CoastCR")

title: Coastal Changes Estimation Based on Baseline and Transect Approach
code: # Load libraries library(sf) library(CoastCR)  # Intersections shapefile shp <- st_read(system.file("./extdata/intersect.shp", package = "CoastCR"))  # Normal lines shapefile normals <- st_read(system.file("./extdata/normals.shp", package = "CoastCR"))  # Table with dates and associated uncertainty table <- read.csv(system.file("./extdata/table_coastlines.csv", package = "CoastCR"))  # Define baseline position. Offshore = OFF; Onshore = ON; Mixed = MIX. position = "OFF"  # Define outputs names out_points <- "./int_filter.shp" out_name <- "./normals_rates.shp"   coast_var(shp, normals, table, position, out_points, out_name)

what: Filter the intersections between transects and shorelines — baseline_filter
title: Filter the intersections between transects and shorelines — baseline_filter
text: baseline_filter allows filter original intersections select closest intersection transect coastline.

title: Filter the intersections between transects and shorelines — baseline_filter
Filter the intersections between transects and shorelines — baseline_filter
text: shp Shapefile. point format shapefile intersections transect shoreline. position character. Default "MIX". position = "MIX" recommended use coastline baseline. baseline position relation coastlines. three options: "MIX" intermediate baselines, "" offshore baselines, "" onshore baselines. out_points Integer. Output name filter intersection points shapefile.

title: Filter the intersections between transects and shorelines — baseline_filter
text: shapefile filtered intersection points, one point transect/shoreline pair.

title: Filter the intersections between transects and shorelines — baseline_filter
text: function part pre-processing stages used ensure baseline-transect, one crossing date-stamped coastline used. filter selects crossing closest baseline neglects others (Gomez-Pazo et al., 2022).

title: Filter the intersections between transects and shorelines — baseline_filter
text: Gomez-Pazo, ., Payo, ., Paz-Delgado, M.V., Delgadillo-Calzadilla, M.. (2022) Open Digital Shoreline Analysis System: ODSAS v1.0 Journal Marine Science Engineering, 10, 26.

title: Filter the intersections between transects and shorelines — baseline_filter
code: #Load libraries library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.10.2, GDAL 3.4.1, PROJ 8.2.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE library(CoastCR) setwd(tempdir())  #Intersections shapefile shp <- st_read(system.file("./extdata/intersect.shp", package = "CoastCR")) #> Reading layer `intersect' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/CoastCR/extdata/intersect.shp'  #>   using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Simple feature collection with 264 features and 3 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 508058.2 ymin: 4674243 xmax: 508101 ymax: 4674329 #> Projected CRS: ETRS89 / UTM zone 29N  #Define baseline position. Offshore = OFF; Onshore = ON; Mixed = MIX. position = "OFF"  #Define output name out_points <- tempfile("inters_filter", fileext = ".shp")  baseline_filter(shp, position, out_points) #> Writing layer `inters_filter19c873ca8f27' to data source  #>   `/tmp/RtmprPwQZs/inters_filter19c873ca8f27.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Writing 128 features with 4 fields and geometry type Point.

text: inter_dist Shapefile. point format shapefile intersections transect shoreline. normals Shapefile. polyline format shapefile normal lines (transects) included study site. table CSV. table information coastlines dates column named "Day" format (YYYYY-mm-dd). information acquisition hour available, user introduce column called "Hour" format (HH:MM:SS) associated uncertainty coastline meters. column names "Day", "Hour" "Uncertainty". out_name Integer. Output name resulting shapefile rates transect.

title: Calculate the coastal variation rates — coast_rates
code: library(sf) library(CoastCR) setwd(tempdir())  #Normal lines shapefile normals <- st_read(system.file("./extdata/normals.shp", package = "CoastCR")) #> Reading layer `normals' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/CoastCR/extdata/normals.shp'  #>   using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Simple feature collection with 16 features and 7 fields #> Geometry type: LINESTRING #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 508009.1 ymin: 4674223 xmax: 508116 ymax: 4674330 #> Projected CRS: ETRS89 / UTM zone 29N  #Table with dates and associated uncertainty table <- read.csv(system.file("./extdata/table_coastlines.csv", package = "CoastCR"))  #Filtered intersections shapefile inter_dist <- st_read(system.file("./extdata/dist.shp", package = "CoastCR")) #> Reading layer `dist' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/CoastCR/extdata/dist.shp'  #>   using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Simple feature collection with 128 features and 4 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 508058.2 ymin: 4674243 xmax: 508101 ymax: 4674329 #> Projected CRS: ETRS89 / UTM zone 29N  #Define output name out_name <- tempfile("normals_coast_rates", fileext = ".shp")  coast_rates(inter_dist, normals, table, out_name) #> Writing layer `normals_coast_rates19c8487c30c9' to data source  #>   `/tmp/RtmprPwQZs/normals_coast_rates19c8487c30c9.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Writing 16 features with 9 fields and geometry type Line String.

title: Filter intersections and estimate variation rates — coast_var
code: coast_var(shp, normals, table, position = "MIX", out_points, out_name)

title: Filter intersections and estimate variation rates — coast_var
text: shp Shapefile. point format shapefile intersections transect shoreline. normals Shapefile. polyline format shapefile normal lines (transects) included study site. table CSV. table information coastlines dates column named "Day" format (YYYYY-mm-dd). information acquisition hour available, user introduce column called "Hour" format (HH:MM:SS) associated uncertainty coastline meters. column names "Day", "Hour" "Uncertainty". position character. Default "MIX". position = "MIX" recommended use coastline baseline. baseline position relation coastlines. three options: "MIX" intermediate baselines, "" offshore baselines, "" onshore baselines. out_points Integer. Output name filter intersection points shapefile. out_name Integer. Output name resulting shapefile rates transect.

title: Filter intersections and estimate variation rates — coast_var
text: shapefile filtered intersection points polyline shapefile rates associated transect. table png format central tendency stats parameter.

title: Filter intersections and estimate variation rates — coast_var
text: coast_var main function included CoastCR version, part ODSAS (Gomez-Pazo et al., 2022). function runs baseline_filter coast_rates entire coastal change process. first step filters intersection points, remove duplicate points selects crossing closest baseline neglects others. second step estimates main coastal variation rates explained detail CoastCR documentation.

title: Filter intersections and estimate variation rates — coast_var
text: Gomez-Pazo, ., Payo, ., Paz-Delgado, M.V., Delgadillo-Calzadilla, M.. (2022) Open Digital Shoreline Analysis System: ODSAS v1.0 Journal Marine Science Engineering, 10, 26.

title: Filter intersections and estimate variation rates — coast_var
code: #Load libraries library(sf) library(CoastCR) setwd(tempdir())  #Intersections shapefile shp <- st_read(system.file("./extdata/intersect.shp", package = "CoastCR")) #> Reading layer `intersect' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/CoastCR/extdata/intersect.shp'  #>   using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Simple feature collection with 264 features and 3 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 508058.2 ymin: 4674243 xmax: 508101 ymax: 4674329 #> Projected CRS: ETRS89 / UTM zone 29N  #Normal lines shapefile normals <- st_read(system.file("./extdata/normals.shp", package = "CoastCR")) #> Reading layer `normals' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/CoastCR/extdata/normals.shp'  #>   using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Simple feature collection with 16 features and 7 fields #> Geometry type: LINESTRING #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 508009.1 ymin: 4674223 xmax: 508116 ymax: 4674330 #> Projected CRS: ETRS89 / UTM zone 29N  #Table with dates and associated uncertainty table <- read.csv(system.file("./extdata/table_coastlines.csv", package = "CoastCR"))  #Define baseline position. Offshore = OFF; Onshore = ON; Mixed = MIX. position = "OFF"  #Define outputs names out_points <- tempfile("int_filter", fileext = ".shp") out_name <- tempfile("normals_rates", fileext = ".shp")  coast_var(shp, normals, table, position, out_points, out_name) #> Writing layer `int_filter19c87bc0e27b' to data source  #>   `/tmp/RtmprPwQZs/int_filter19c87bc0e27b.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Writing 128 features with 4 fields and geometry type Point. #> Reading layer `int_filter19c87bc0e27b' from data source  #>   `/tmp/RtmprPwQZs/int_filter19c87bc0e27b.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Simple feature collection with 128 features and 4 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 508058.2 ymin: 4674243 xmax: 508101 ymax: 4674329 #> Projected CRS: ETRS89 / UTM zone 29N #> Writing layer `normals_rates19c87f17f48a' to data source  #>   `/tmp/RtmprPwQZs/normals_rates19c87f17f48a.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Writing 16 features with 9 fields and geometry type Line String.

title: CoastCR 1.2.0
text: version incorporates change Date format. Currently, user can select one shoreline day. , user introduced table dates associated uncertainty column named “Day” format (YYYYY-mm-dd). information acquisition hour available, user introduce column called “Hour” format (HH:MM:SS). Now column names “Day”, “Hour” “Uncertainty”. data include hour information, remove column avoid possible errors.
